extendedIngredients.name: thick-cut bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 pound thick-cut bacon, cut into 1/4-inch strips

title: Smoky Brussels Sprouts
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Smoky Brussels Sprouts a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free and primal recipe has 207 calories, 9g of protein, and 15g of fat per serving. For $1.44 per serving, this recipe covers 19% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. Head to the store and pick up brussels sprouts, salt and pepper, cream, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 64%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Smoky, Lemony Saut√©ed Shredded Brussels Sprouts, Fried Brussels Sprouts with Smoky Honey Aioli, and Brussels Sprouts and Smoky Onions on Cheddar Toast.
instructions: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add the brussels sprouts and cook over high heat until tender but still bright green, about 3 minutes. Drain well, reserving about 2 tablespoons of the cooking liquid.                                              In a large skillet, cook the bacon over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, 7 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts and cook over moderately high heat for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the sour cream and the reserved cooking liquid and simmer over moderate heat until the brussels sprouts are coated. Season with salt and pepper, transfer to a bowl and serve.

steps.step: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil.
Add the brussels sprouts and cook over high heat until tender but still bright green, about 3 minutes.
Drain well, reserving about 2 tablespoons of the cooking liquid.
In a large skillet, cook the bacon over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, 7 minutes.
Add the brussels sprouts and cook over moderately high heat for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the sour cream and the reserved cooking liquid and simmer over moderate heat until the brussels sprouts are coated. Season with salt and pepper, transfer to a bowl and serve.
